d Use of Seals and Logos e:\seals\archives.ai The seal of the Natio
al Archives and Records Administration (NARA) authenticates the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR)
s the official codification of Federal regulations established under the Federal Register Act. Under the
rovisions of 44 U.S.C. 1507, the con
ents of the CFR, a special edition of the Federal Register, shall be judicially noticed. The CFR is prima facie evidence of
the original docume
ts pu
lished in the Fe
eral Reg
ster (44 U.S.C.
510). It is prohibited to use NARA's official seal an
the stylized Code of Federal Regulations logo on any republication of this material without the express, written permission of the Archivist of the United States or the Archivist
s designee. Any person usin
NARA's official seals and logos in a manner inconsistent with the provisions of 36 CFR part 1200 is subject to the
penalties specified in 18 U.S.C. 506, 701, and 1017. Us
o

ent Publishing Office Official Editions only. The Sup

ntendent of Documents of the U.S. Government Publishing Office requests that any reprinted edition clearly be labeled as a
opy of the authentic work with a new ISBN. e:\seals

the C
R 1117 List of CFR Sections Affected 11
7 Cite
his Code:â€ƒCFR To cite the regulations in this volume
use title, part and section numb
r. Thus, 22 CF
1.1 refers to title 22,
art 1, s
ct
on 1. Expla
ation The Code of Federal Regulations is a codification of the general and permanent rules published in the Fe
eral Register by the Executiv
departments and
agencies of the Federal Government. The Code is divided into 50 titles which represent broad areas subject
o Federal regulation. Each title is divided
nto chapter
whi
h usually bear
he name of the issuing agency. Each chapter is further subdivide
int
parts covering specific regulat
ry areas. Each volume of the Code is revised at
least once ea
h calendar year and iss
ed on a quarterly b
sis approximately as fo
lows: Title 1 through Title 16 as of January 1 Titl
17 through Title 27 as of Ap
il 1 T
tle 28 through Title 41 as of July 1 Title 42 through Title 50 as of October 1 The appropriate revision date is
printed on the cover of each volume. LEGAL STATUS The contents of the Federal
egister a
e required to be judicially noticed (44 U.S.C. 1507). The Code of Federal Regulations is prima facie evidence of the text of the origina
documents (44 U.S.C. 15
). HOW TO USE THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS The Code of Federal

Regulations is kept up to date by the individual issues of the Federal Register. These two publications must be used together to determine the latest version of any given rule. To determine whether a Code volume has been amended since its revis
on date
n this case, April 1, 2019), consult the â€œList of CFR Sections Affected (LS
),â€ which is issued mon
hly, and the â€œCumulative List of Parts Affected,â€ which appears in the Reader Aids section of the daily Federal Register. These two lists will i
entify the Federal Register page number of the latest amendment of any given rule. EFFECTIVE AND EXPIRATION DATES Each volume of the Code contains amend
ents published in the Federal Regis
er since the last rev
sion of that volume of the Co
e
Source citations f
r the regul
tions
re referred to by volume number and page number of the Federal Regis
er and date of publication. Publication dates and effective dat
s are usua
ly not
the same and care must be exercised by the user in determining the actual effective da
e. In instances where the effective
d
te is b
ond the cut-off date for
he Code a note
has been inserted to reflect t
e future e
fective date. In those instances where a regulation
ubli
hed in the Federal Register st
tes a date certain for expiration, an appropriate note will be inserted following the text. OMB CONTROL NUMBERS The Paperwork Reduction Act of 1980 (Pub
requires Federal agencies to display an OMB control number with their information collection request. Many agencies have begun publish
ng numerous OMB control numbers as amendments to existing re
ulations in the
FR. These OMB numbers are placed as close as possible to the applicable recordkeeping or reporting requirements. PAST PROVISIONS OF THE CODE
rovisions of the Code that are no longer in force and effect as of the revision date stated on the cover of each volume are not carried. Code us
rs may find the text of provisions in effect on any given date in the past by using
he appropriate List of CFR Sections Affected (LSA). For the convenience of the reader, a â€œList of CFR Sections A
fecte
â€ is published at the end of each CFR volume. For changes to the Code prior to the LSA listings at
he end of the volume, consult previous annual editions of the LSA. For changes to t
e Code
prior to 2001, consult the List of CFR Sections Affected compilations, published f
4-1972, 1973-1985, and 1986-2000. â€œ[RESERVED]â€ TERMINOLOGY The term â€œ[Reserved]â€ is used a
a place holder within the Code of F

deral Regulations. An agency may add regulatory information at a â€œ[Reserved]â€ location at any time. Occasionally â€œ[Reserved]â€ is used editorially to indicate that a portion of the CFR was left vacant and not accidentally dropped due to a printing or compute

diff.a: error.
NCORPORATION B
REFERENCE What is incorporation
y reference? Incorporation by reference was established by statute and allows Federal agencies to meet the requirement to publish regulati
ns in the Federal Regi
t
r by referring to materials already published elsewhe
e. For an i
corp
ration to be valid, the Director of the Federal Register must
approve it. The legal effect of incorporation by reference is tha
the material is treated as if it were published in full in the
ederal Register (5 U.S.C. 552(a)). This material, like any other properly is
ued reg
lation, has the force of law. Wha
is a prop
r incorporation by reference? The Director of the Federal Register will approve an incorporation by reference only when the requirements of 1 CFR part 51 are met. Some of the elements on which appro
al is based are: (a) The incorporation will substantially reduce the vo
ume of ma
erial pub
ished in the
Federal Register. (b) The matter incorporated is in fact available to the extent necessary to afford fairness and uniformity in th
administrative process. (c) The incorporating document is drafted and submitted for publication in accordance with 1 CFR part 51. What
if the material incorporated by reference cannot be found? If you
ave any problem locating o
obtaining a copy of material lis
ed
s an
pproved incorporation by reference, please contact the agency that issued the regulation containing th
t incorporation. If, after contacting the agency, you find the material is not available, please notify th
Director of
he Federal R
gister, National Archives and Records Administration,
601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001, or call 202-741-6010. CFR INDEXES AND TABULAR
UIDES A subject index to the Code of Federal Regulations is contained in a separate volume, revised annually as of January 1, entitled CFR Index and Finding Aids. This volume c
ntains the Parallel Table of Authorities
nd Rules.
A list of CFR titles, chapters, subchapters
and parts and an alphabetical list of agencies publishing in the CFR are also inclu
ed in this volume. An inde
to the text of â€œTitle 3â€”The Presidentâ€ is carried within that volu
e. The Federal Register Index is issued monthly in cu
ulative form. Thi
index is based on a consolidation of the â€œContentsâ€ entries in the daily Federal Register. A List of CFR Sections Af
ected (LSA) is published monthly, keyed to the revision dates of the 50 CFR
it
es. REPUBLI
ATION OF MATERIAL There are no restri
tions on the republication of material appearing in the Code of Federal Regulations. INQ
IRIES For a legal interpretation or explanation of any regulation in this volume, contact the issuing agency. T
e issuing agency's name appears at the top of odd-numbered pages. For inquiries concerning CFR reference assistance, call 202-741-600
or write to the Director, Office of the Federal Register, National Archi
es and Records Administration, 8601 A
elphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001 or e-mail fedreg.info@nara.gov. SALES The Government Publishing Office (GPO)
processes all sales and distribution of the CFR. For payment by credit card, call toll-free, 866-512-180
, or DC area, 202-512-1800, M-F 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. e.s.t. or
fax your order to 202-512-2104, 24 hours a day. For payment by check, write
o: US Government Pub
i
hing Office - New Orders, P.O. Box 979050, St. Louis, MO 63197-9000. ELEC
RONIC SERVICES Th
ull text of the
Code
f Feder
l Regu
ations, the LSA (List of CFR
ections Affected), The United State
Government Manual, the Federal Register, Pub
ic Laws, P
blic Papers of the Presidents of the United
States, Compilation of Presidential Documents and the Privacy Act Compilation are available in electronic format via www.govinfo.gov.
